page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: large Wixon Farm.{In general} permanent and ley grass is grown and utilised as pasture, hay, or silage; arable farming that does take place is grown on better drained lands with a good aspect and is essentially fodder crops like barley, oats, swedes with reed corn and wheat grown for both feed and thatching. Farms are pastural Dairy milk and wool is sold to the statutory Marketing Boards. Meat to N. Devon Meat Ltd, butchers, or sold at auction at the Markets at Hatherleigh, South Molton, Exeter, Barnstaple or even Bridgwater. The Culm Measure clay requires drainage and to varying degrees all farms have underground pipes to prevent water-logging - except when heavy rains occur! Every dairy herd has replacement heifers; sheep herds, replacement ewes - the surplus is sold. Fertilisers and weed
